title: What Is ‘The Life Of A Showgirl’ Release Date? Everything To Know About TS12
description: A new Taylor Swift era is here. When does “The Life of a Showgirl” drop? Here’s everything to know about the release date, rumored collabs and TS12 (so far).
content:
Welcome to the orange era. Taylor Swift has announced her 12th studio album and is expected to reveal the cover art and more details on the New Heights podcast this week. Here’s everything to know so far about TS12, including clues about its possible release date.

On Monday, Aug. 11, a cryptic countdown appeared on her website, following a long trail of Easter eggs dating all the way back to her time on the Eras Tour. Perhaps the biggest clue came after Taylor Nation, Swift’s official management team, posted a variety of photos of the singer in orange-hued outfits on Instagram. “Thinking about when she said “See you next era… ❤️‍🔥” the caption read.

On the same day, Travis and Jason Kelce’s podcast, New Heights, teased that a very special guest would be joining the brothers this Wednesday — and the silhouette of the guest looked very similar to Swift’s. The image was also set against a sparkly orange background, which corresponds with the orange-themed outfits from Taylor Nation.

What Is The Name Of TS12?

Swift’s 12th studio album is titled The Life of a Showgirl. The announcement was made on the singer’s official website during the early morning hours of August 12. Taylor Nation also posted a clip of Swift sharing the name of the record with Travis and Jason Kelce on their hit sports podcast New Heights.

“At 12:12 on the 12th, TS12 finally got a name: The Life of a Showgirl. ❤️‍🔥 More info soon… pre pre-order the album & pre pre-scream in the meantime!!!!!!!!!!!!” Taylor Nation wrote alongside the New Heights teaser.

What Is The Life Of A Showgirl Release Date?

The exact release date for The Life of a Showgirl has yet to be announced. However, according to Taylor’s website, the album will ship by October 13, 2025 — so the release date will be before then. “This is not the release date. Official release date to be announced," the website clarified.

For now, you can pre-order the album on Swift’s official website as a CD with a poster ($12.99), cassette ($19.99) and vinyl ($29.99).

Who Are The Producers On The Life Of A Showgirl?

Along with the album announcement, Swift released a playlist titled And, baby, that’s show business for you ❤️‍🔥, which includes 22 tracks from various albums. Swifties were quick to point out that all the songs were produced by the songwriting and production duo, Max Martin and Shellback, with whom the singer collaborated on Red, 1989 and Reputation.

Will The Life Of A Showgirl Feature Any Collabs?

There’s a strong chance that Sabrina Carpenter will appear on The Life of a Showgirl, thanks to a list of clues, including her website featuring the date August 12, 2025. Carpenter was also included in the 12-photo carousel Taylor Nation posted teasing the pop star’s “new era.”

Here are more fan guesses about Carpenter’s rumored involvement:

When Is Taylor Swift Revealing The Life Of A Showgirl Cover Art?

Swift will be revealing The Life of a Showgirl cover art during the next episode of the New Heights podcast, which will be released on Wednesday, August 13, at 7 p.m. ET. You can listen to the episode on Wondery, Apple Music, Spotify, YouTube and more.

Stay tuned for more details about TS12, including the official cover art, tracklist, release date and more.
summary: Taylor Swift has announced her 12th studio album, The Life of a Showgirl, and is expected to reveal the cover art and more details on the New Heights podcast later this week. The album was named after Taylor Nation, Swift's official management team, and announced on her website on August 11. The release date for the album has not yet been announced. The cover art will be revealed during the next episode of the podcast New Heights. There is a strong chance that Sabrina Carpenter will appear on The Life Of A Showgirl due to several clues, including a cryptic countdown on Taylor Nation's website and a potential guest joining Travis and Jason Kelce's podcast, New Heights, on Wednesday.
shortSummary: Taylor Swift announced her 12th album, The Life of a Showgirl, with clues regarding its release date and possible collaborations.

scraped_sources.text:
Are you ready for Taylor Swift to begin a new era? Now that the billionaire superstar officially owns her masters, the final two re-recordings are likely taking a backseat. Thanks to the Easter eggs dropped by Swift and her team, Swifties are convinced that new music is coming soon — and what better way to reveal TS12 than on New Heights?
The chatter about Swift’s potential appearance on Travis and Jason Kelce’s podcast, New Heights, started on Monday, August 11, when the podcast's X account teased that a very special guest would be joining the brothers this Wednesday.
“92%ers, we’re coming back early for a special episode with a VERY special guest,” the caption read. “New episode Wednesday 7PM ET.”
Swifties flocked to the comments, noting how the silhouette in the picture looks very similar to Taylor’s — bangs, long hair, and all.
“I KNOW THOSE BANGS ANYWHERE HELLO,” one user commented. Another fan noticed that Jason is wearing what appears to be a shirt with the singer’s face on it, and the background is a glittering orange (we’ll get to the significance of the color later). Oh, and the episode drops on the 13th, which just happens to be Taylor’s lucky number.
Is Taylor Swift Announcing New Music On New Heights This Week?
If Swift is a special guest on Wednesday’s episode, there’s a strong chance she could also announce new music. Taylor Nation, the official account of Taylor Swift’s management team, has been dropping hints that the singer may be revealing something big soon.
On August 11, the same day as the New Heights teaser, the Taylor Nation Instagram account shared a 12-photo carousel. The caption read, “Thinking about when she said ‘See you next era…’” and the photos showed Swift in a variety of orange Eras Tour looks.
Fans noted that the missing album color in Taylor Swift’s discography is orange, suggesting that TS12 could revolve around the orange hue. “TS12 IS ORANGE DEFINITELY," one Swiftie commented. “12 pictures, every outfit is orange. This has to mean something 🧡🧡🧡” wrote another.
What Are Other Easter Eggs Pointing To TS12?
The Instagram carousel is just one of the Easter eggs hinting that Swift's next album, TS12, is on the horizon. Here are even more signs sleuths have put together:
- When celebrating a new album from her BFF Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco, Swift posted the caption, “I LOVE THIS ALBUM SO MUCH OH MY GODDDDDDDDDDDD.” The singer used 12 d’s in god.
- In an Instagram post marking her return to the U.S. for the Era’s Tour, the artist held her cat Meredith in the A12 section of Hard Rock Stadium.
- At the 2025 Grammy Awards, she had 12 red rubies in her earrings and leg chain.
- When she revealed that she now owns her masters, the letter included 12 i’s in “thiiiiiiiiiiiis,” while the single numbers in the letter of 4, 6 and 2 add up to 12. The letterhead also featured a new "TS" diamond logo with 12 segments.
- In December, Us Weekly reported Swift was considering getting to “work on a new album” and was talking “about hitting the road again—albeit on a smaller scale than the Eras Tour—in 2026.”
When Does the New Heights Podcast Come Out?
The New Heights podcast will be released on Wednesday, August 13, at 7 p.m. ET. You can listen to the podcast on Wondery, Apple Music, Spotify, YouTube and more.
Stay tuned to learn more details.

Taylor Swift officially landed on Forbes’ billionaires list on Tuesday, April 2. But what distinguishes the 34-year-old singer-songwriter from other wealthy artists is how she accumulated her billion-dollar fortune.
The Miss Americana star ranked No. 2,545 on Forbes’ World’s Billionaires List. According to Forbes, there are more billionaires than ever before (141 more than last year and 26 more than the 2021 record), with their collective worth reaching $14.2 trillion. Swift’s inclusion comes after Forbes declared the singer a billionaire in October 2023 and reported her net worth at $1.1 billion.
In a rare feat, Swift is the first musician to reach the milestone solely from songwriting and performing. Her fortune doesn’t largely derive from profitable side hustles (think: beauty brands, fashion lines, alcohol investments, etc.), which have been typical avenues for entertainers to become billionaires in recent years. This puts her in a unique category with artists like Bruce Springsteen, who earned $1 billion from on the road touring.
More than $500 million of Swift’s fortune is from music royalties and touring. She made an estimated $190 million after taxes from the first leg of the Eras tour and another $35 million from the first two weeks of screenings of the corresponding concert film, Taylor Swift: The Eras Tour, which became the highest-grossing concert movie in history.
Best High-Yield Savings Accounts Of 2024
Best 5% Interest Savings Accounts of 2024
Meanwhile, another $500 million of her earnings came from the increasing value of her music catalog. Her masters (Swift’s first six albums) were infamously purchased in 2019 by Scooter Braun and eventually sold to Shamrock Capital for $300 million in 2020.
“This is my worst case scenario. This is what happens when you sign a deal at fifteen to someone for whom the term ‘loyalty’ is clearly just a contractual concept,” Swift penned on Tumblr in 2019 when she learned that Braun had bought her masters. “Now Scooter has stripped me of my life’s work, that I wasn’t given an opportunity to buy. Essentially, my musical legacy is about to lie in the hands of someone who tried to dismantle it.”
At the time, Swift also parted ways with her long-time home, Big Machine Label Group, to join Universal Music Group’s Republic Records, a deal that would give the superstar complete ownership over songwriting and the recordings, ultimately boosting her earnings in the long run.
"I'm ecstatic to announce that my musical home will be Republic Records and Universal Music Group," Swift wrote on Instagram about the news. "Over the years, [UMG chief] Sir Lucian Grainge and [Republic chief] Monte Lipman have been such incredible partners. It's so thrilling to me that they, and the UMG team, will be my label family moving forward. It's also incredibly exciting to know that I'll own all of my master recordings that I make from now on."
Since switching labels, Swift has released four new albums, Lover, Folklore, Evermore and Midnights, and re-recorded Fearless (Taylor’s Version), Red (Taylor’s Version), Speak Now (Taylor’s Version) and 1989 (Taylor’s Version). Swift’s the sole writer on over one-fourth of her top 50 Billboard chart hits, although she frequently shares writing credits with collaborators like Jack Antonoff and Max Martin, who also get a portion of a record sale.
On April 19, the pop star will release her 11th studio album, The Tortured Poets Department, which will also add to her massive earnings. Swift announced the new record during her Album of the Year win acceptance speech at the 2024 Grammy Awards in February.
While becoming a billionaire, the singer made a huge monetary impact on the NFL. Swift created a brand value equivalent of $331.5 million for the Chiefs and the league, according to data from Apex Marketing Group. That number comes from print, digital, radio, TV, highlights, and social media mentioning Swift from her first game on Sept. 24 to Jan. 22.
One of Swift’s many accomplishments from last year also includes being named Time Magazine’s 2023 Person of the Year. In her interview with journalist Sam Lansky, Swift told the magazine that “this is the proudest and happiest I’ve ever felt, and the most creatively fulfilled and free I’ve ever been.”

argos_summary: Taylor Swift has announced her 12th studio album, titled "The Life of a Showgirl," with more details expected to be revealed on the New Heights podcast. A countdown on her website and hints from her management team suggest a strong connection to the color orange, which may signify the theme of the new era. While the exact release date is not yet confirmed, the album is set to ship by October 13, 2025, and fans can pre-order it now. Additionally, there are speculations about potential collaborations, particularly with Sabrina Carpenter.
